reviewText: This game is great rough around the edges but great this game has been around 2003 and still is getting updated and still alot of people play. It's a MMO RPG and you can learn any skills if you try hard enough playing with warrior but still want to have bow magic or alchemy on your side No Problem! you just have to learn the skills and train them. The level up system is like any other train skill kill enemys no problem but there is a rebirth option this allows you to keep you total level this mean you get more ap when you rebirth because leveling up is easyer when you got that nice sword of yours you do keep your hp/mp/sm (health/mana/stamina) and your skills that you trained. the only downside is travel/getting gold now there are ways of getting gold kinda have to work your way up and get more as you go along now for travel if you do most of the starter quests you get a horse and a eagle but they are limited each day when you summon them they have a timer that goes down but can be stopped when you finish summoning them and the time refills every day and the time limit for the horse is around 90 mins and the eagle around 80 mins still plenty of time. There is plenty to see and do there is also life skills mostly such as things as cooking potion making and fishing just a name few of many. There is a problem with the skills if you want to learn all of them your gonna have to take some time and scroll but there are filters to help you pick if it is a life skill or magic or fighting but some skills don't have this filter at the moment but if you like hotkeying then you'll have plenty of time to. There are plenty of quests but some are a little tricky to understand but there is a wiki page for mabinogi (if you need to resort to this) you can sarch up your quest and there is likely plenty of pages from the community and strait from the wiki to help you along. For the players or fanbase most of them are realy nice but some do get into charater or just hard to talk to but this only come time to time for most of the people ive met most of them are nice players. So if you thinking of downloading this game I highly suggest not to do ace but if you think you need some help going into the direction of fighting/life skills then use aces but if you want to spread into many skills and see for your self how you like them i would choose milletian. Over all this game is great if i would to rate it id give it 9/10 for the missing 1 there are bugs that break the flow of the game but mostly doesnt happen such as npcs won't move from there position you can see the npc try to move in a direction but won't move by just teleporting back from where they were and you can walk using the wasd keys but sometimes get trapped when trying to move foward (moslty is dungeons) but other than that the game flows nicely and i highly recommend downloading and give a try p.s. you do need to create a nexon account register with one if you have one if you ever played vindictus or maplestroy and registed with your nexon account you should be good. ALSO if you notice my hours it's because i register with a wrong nexon account so i went in to steam files you can run it from there (mabinogi.exe) all the diffrence is you have to logon every time you get on not that big of a bother to me.

Long before I've started my time in Mabinogi, I enjoyed MMORPGs mainly for the communities within. Many early MMOs tend to have helpful communities, which is why I joined in on this joy ride the moment I knew about it.

Mabinogi started off as a simple game of rock, paper and scissors. The three basic combat skill goes with Defense, which blocks normal attack, Smash, which breaks through Defense, and Counter, the skill that allows you to counterattack Smash. The skills are based upon loading time and latency, meaning that if you lag, it is more or so likely that this game will be more difficult for you.

The game evolved from simple melee, magic and archery to the wide spectrum of skills you have today; from sharpshooting to even puppetry, where you make use of puppets to fight for you. The community was welcoming in the past, and the game was fresh, being a half-sandbox, half-quest-and-instance based orientated RP. Events were plentiful, and every day would be an interesting experience for all.

-----

Skills, level and attributes:

Mabinogi is a game with endless possibilities. With hundreds of different skills, you have countless ways to combine and make use of the combat technique of your dreams. Feel like being a gunmage? Mabinogi has that. A spellknight? No problem-o! Perhaps you are a fan of Naruto and you would like to use ninjitsu along with puppetry? Mabinogi has it all.

It is generally one of the most complex, and yet simple, game I've ever played. Skills are trained based on how much you use them, and sometimes it can be quite a grind. However, ever since the Adventurer's Seal Shop update, players can purchase skill seals every Sunday to help with training on difficult skill ranks.

Attributes are mainly gained via levelling up, or ranking of skills. Based off the game's endless possibilities of limitless levels, you can get your character up to insane tiers. For example, the maximum level limit for every Life" is capped at 200

reviewText:
Although it is advertised as a free to play game, sometimes I feel like I can't afford to play this game if I did not have the incentive of playing for such a long time.  I would recommend this game as an exploration tour of how different and open-ended this MMORPG compared to others, with its unique leveling system. I however advise not to get too attached to it as a long-term game, due to getting and creating great equipment relies heavily on the cash shop rather then skill and labor (via fine reforges and prenchanted gachapon items.)

+ Very Open-Ended Character Customization; you'll be sticking to one character and he'll eventually have every skill.
+ Unique Leveling System;  Although it follows traditional leveling; your relative power is based on what skills you invested in. Combined with the ability to reset your level AND keep your skills that you have ranked over time, you will continue to grow and grow.
+ Unique Combat System; This is a not a turn-based combat where your stats and gear can save you, but rather skill-based.
+ Consistent Flow of Events; Rarely you will never see a day in Mabinogi without an in-game event going on, so you can find yourself occupied with something new every week. Great goodies for everybody.
+ Aesthethics; You find more then 1000+ types of clothing to decorate how your character will look, and the ability to dye them to the color of what you want.

- P2W Cash Shop; The introduction of fine reforges and gachapon (enchanted gear, titles that increase your stats, buff potions, etc) tend to drive competitive PvE'ers away. Maintaining good gear is extremely expensive, but these are fortunately tradable from other players.
- Server-sided Issues; This game is very prone to rubberbanding and lagging at times during peak hours.

reviewText:
A game that seems amicable at first glance and for the first few weeks of playing soon turned into your personal hell. Mabinogi has a way of looking and feeling amazingly pretty until you start noticing what you've been ignoring. Over the course of six years this game has grown and showed a lot of progress, but at the same time hasn't shown progress where people want it shown. Either abuse your wallet with cosmetic items, pets, and gambling gachapon to amass your pride, or spend year after year working up to a higher place to the point where you feel you're actually good at the game to not feel content because of the amount of time you spent on it with little to show.
Pros:
- Rebirthing; The ability to reset level and change age after a week, rebirthing will allow you to change your age and level, allowing you accumulate a higher cumulative level, which gives means a lot more points for skills that would normally be limited by a level cap.
- Talent System; There is no classes in Mabinogi, only talents. Every rebirth, from creation on you are forced to choose one of seventeen(fc) talents. Choosing a talent will provide bonus experience when training skills of that selected talent, and some offer unique tips and tidbits, like any of the adventure talents will show you locations of smugglers.
- The fact that there's so many talents to choose from. There's a lot to do in the game, from being a grandmaster warrior to gaining the highest magic attack, from using alchemy to dual guns. The choice of having puppets to fight for you, or using a ninja star to level the playing field. There are a ton of weapon archetypes, and if you aren't into combat, there are life skill talents such as cooking, blacksmithing, tailoring and adventure. Each of these are a welcome new change when you get tired of the usual.
- The community. Say what you will, the community is a positive and negative thing. While there are some people who  are snobby and elitists about fashion or combat, there will always be a few people you can befriend and have a great time with.
- Beginner bonuses: This game is a whole lot more friendly to new players than it was when many veterans started playing. From free skill resets to multiple character slots, being under the cumulative level of 1,000 provides a lot of nifty bonuses that surely help out.
- Events: Another positive and negative, there are a lot of events. Events, while either tedious or not viable for everyone give opportunity to get some decent items and experience, and most are repeatable within the time frame the event lasts. Most MMOs I've played have advent calenders or double experience events, but Mabinogi provides from role playing dungeon events to daily gathering/tasks to  get good rewards.
-Strong Update: While a lot of the problems I wish were solved aren't, the developers aren't stupid. They notice things that many players have issue with, and aim to fix them. Before, inventory was limited to a main 6 x 10 slotted inventory, and eventually if you paid money per month you'd be available to use additional inventory slots. Since, that's become a free service. There are constant updates that help a lot.
- Player-Based economy you will see here and in cons. The reason for this is because items are usually a bidding items in trading or selling from player to player, so it's not rare to find someone selling an item you think looks cool for an affordable price.
- Free services. While the game has a literal ton of items and pets and advantages you can get from using in real life cash, with a bit of hard work and dedication, you can get a good amount of stuff that will benefit you as much.
Cons:
- Player Based economy is my biggest issue with the game. While there are good things about it, there's also the fact that not every item is in abundance, and a lot of items wont be cheap. That isn't my issue though, my issue therein lies that players are given too much power in deciding how the economy shifts. Recently, a lot of people have taken to trading in game items for real cash, upwards from fifty to over two hundred dollars. For singular cosmetic items. This is insanely limiting, and not to mention against the terms of service, but little is being done about it.
- The cash shop; It doesn't provide many things that completely shift the balance of the game, but there are some things. While you can't outright buy an end-game weapon, you may buy gachapon which offers anywhere from useless common items to rare and near end-game items with a higher grade. There are also pets, which once you have some, feel like a necessity to the game. It boosts overall speed of play as well. Why walk from one area to another when you can just get on your 3x movement speed flying horse and dash through the skies. Pets also sometimes provide a combat bonus of stats after a certain time of being summoned, or AoE attacks on summon or in their skill tab that you won't get otherwise. These save hides, and make the game a /lot/ easier. Most of these items and pets are unobtainable by others means, unless you buy them with gold from other players; and pets are not tradeable(usually).
-The voidless gap and journey to end game. For people that are casually playing this, this does not apply to you. After a while, you'll take notice to the difficulties of the game, from Basic to Heroic/Lord/Elite. It's because it's a classless system that viability becomes a problem. Chances are, if you don't stick with your initial combat-oriented talent, you won't be as strong as half the players. While combinations are great in this game, until all used combinations are maxed out, you'll be doing far below normal damage. Stats are also a pain for this. You might reach the level needed for a new difficulty, but stats are a problem. If you choose to be an Archer, chances are your damage will be insanely lacking, and this is because more than half the gainable Dexterity(source of damage for archery) comes from life skills that either you aren't looking at, or do not want to waste time and effort ranking. The only clear answer for this is a recent game mechanic, Reforging which amplifies the ability of your skills and stats on equipment. The problem with this is that the NPC-sellable kit won't make a big difference for you, and the rest of the kits are in the cash shop, as well as not definite. So, even if you do buy from players or the cash shop, there's a chance you'll need anywhere between one and a hundred kits to get the effect you want.
- Skills: Other than communication, you'll be spending your time ranking skills. Unlike most games, you don't just level up and spend your points on skills. Skills have requirements in order to be ranked that get tedious as the rank up. The requirements could go from use this skill five times to use this skill five thousand times to rank it. This is why talents are cool, it cuts requirements in half.
- Gear and crafting is a pain, if you're used to the usual oh cool
date: boss dropped a rare drop. wooo
recommended: enough mats to craft my ultra legacy weapon." Mabinogi doesn't do that. Most good items are bought with currencies from doing daily quests or through crafting which is rigarous compared to other games where mats are common. Most of the mats needed are scarce and require hard mode dungeons or difficult tasks such as raids.\n- Performance. The game was released in Korea in 2004. The system is ages old

reviewText:
Mabinogi What makes this game so unique and a game I fall back to every time?
- Huge storyline and tons of quests, I have played the game for years and I've barely scratched the surface.
- Very unique combat system, a great combination that makes combat very enjoyable.
- Free to play from the start, the only things really worth buying are pets, and quite a few are available for free.
- Thousands of items and most of them are dyable, enough said.
- Merchant system and Trading system
- No predefined classes! You can choose a talent which increases xp gain for those abilities associated with the talents.
- To go with the above, yes! abilities individually rank, similar to how Vindictus is handled. Once you complete objectives associated with each rank and you have gained enough ability points from leveling or completing quests you can advance a rank, making the skill more powerful.
- Did I mention there's tons of abilities? You can even become a blacksmith!
- Not a drop off game, there's events almost weekly, each offer custom clothing and gear that may not be available for a long time.
- Many more features!

I really recommend this game, I played this game before it was even on steam. Please give it a try!
I play on Alexina, Add me on steam if you are interested in playing.
voteText: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Mabinogi Has got to be my most memoriable and enjoy mmorpg that ive ever played . Originally i started playing when i was 10 probably back when g3 was already out , i dindt know what i was doing then , came back 2 years later (age 12) when g9 was released and still play it to this day (age 17) where its already at g18 hopefully g19 soon to come.

In my years of playing i can simply say that mabi has transformed throughout the years , originally the combat was slower and more strategic and was built towards partying with other players in order to defeat dungeons and shadow missions etc , once combat was overhauled the gameplay moved faster , most ppl missed the old mabi and some probably left but i stayed and grew with the game as well .

Id have to say that my favorite aspect of the game is how easily you can get involved with the storyline and how oringinal the quests are , mabi is far from your hack and slash  mmo like wow or ya know games like that its very difficult to get bored in mabi since there is so much to do ... ill list those later

Community- im not to sure how the communities are on all server ( i am on Alexina)  but as far as i can see mabis community is very friendly , you can easily get along with most ppl and build long lasting friendships , joining a guild was also one of my best decisions ive made in this game cause without it id have never met the friends i have in mabi now !

This game also caters to several different audiences , if you are a pvper , pver , life skiller , or okay for a storyline you will have something to do in mabi !

Gameplay - asides from questing and doing the main story generation quests players can run dungeons , shadow missions , theater missions , joust , join the fashion contest , cooking contest , commerce , ferment wine ,raft , hot air baloon , playing the egg guarding mini game , forest of purifaction mini game , and so much more !

Many ppl say that this game is practicly a p2p game , sure u can and probably will buy a mount in the future with nx but its honestly not needed these days , b4 a year ago non premium players could not own shops , or have there full bank account open once they passed lvl 30 , now they have access to setting up shops ( or using the shop bag for extra inventory) and all bank space opened for all characters , and u can get a free character of each race if you start of with a human . so lets see if u need inventory ( which you will ) get your 3 characters , so u get 3 bank slots , get shop bags , do g16 for another bag , and complete g18 on all your players for a free pegasus mount that offers alot of space , not to mention alot of events go on that offer free pets !

As i mentioned b4 there are alot of events in mabi usually 1 or 2 a month

Classes - mabinogi offers the ability to use all forms of classes as well as a rebirth system ( rebirthing allows you to reset your current lvl ( not your total ) and quickly lvl up to gain ap to rank your skills (skills start an novince and go from rank f to A and 9 to 1) so there is no lvl cap , players are also given the ability to chose a talent which is like a class bonus for double skill training as well as stat perks  there is just so much in this game that you'd be crazy to pass it by !

The only downsides Mabi  has in my opinion doesnt even have to deal with mabinogi , the company that runs the NA server is called Nexon and they arent the best with customer service respond time , as well as Server lag but thats some we all deal with and u get used to it , seriously give hte game a go you may fall in love with it ! ~ Gregthegreat of Alexina

Also Mabinogi has probably one of the best wikis for any mmo out there if  you are confused on anything they have the solution !

reviewText:
I’ve never been able to get the Steam version of this game to work, hence why my steam time is non-existent.
That being said, and before I get started, just a quick note: This game CAN be fun, Hell, even now I find myself playing it sometimes.
But still... I can’t, in good conscience, recommend it.
There’s a reason it’s FREE, after all.

Pros:
Free
No combat required to gain experience
Tons of different activities you can do, from making clothes, mining, to decorating your home-y space, or going dungeon-ing, etc
The soundtrack is awesome

Cons:
Lots of the good stuff is locked behind a paywall.  To be expected but that still  doesn’t make it a good thing.  *shrug*

A Glitchy, unforgiving mess  (Want to finish your mission?  Too bad.  The door’s glitched.  Have fun doing it all over again.  Oh, hey invisible bandits that the devs still can’t be bothered to fix. Have fun with that.  Oh hey, the game just crashed and now you’re being penalized for it.  Enjoy the profit loss. Hey, don’t you just love it when the enemies can steal from you when they are that far away? Or attack you through walls?  Well, they can. Oh and don’t you just love it when people in your party can steal gold from you with their dolls? Let’s all be thieves. Cheers!)

Community is crap  (Sure, it’s nowhere near as bad as WoW’s but it’s STILL crap. Don’t let anyone tell you otherwise.  Want to enter that dungeon that requires another player?  Only if you bribe them. ^^  Want to get some black dye?  Cough up a million.  Want ANYTHING?  Cough up millions.)  Only play this game if you have friends that do too.

The Cooking Mini Game from Hell  (Many a rage-quit to be had.  Fun stuff. Those that have ranked Cooking up to 5 already know what I mean. We got through hell guys.  *highfives* )

Very very very grindy

Seriously, If you are not patient, just save yourself time and sanity and avoid this game like the plague.  It’s an MMO so grinding is to be expected, but Mabinogi takes it to stupidly absurd levels.
Want to max windmill for the title?  Have fun windmilling 4k+  enemies of various CP levels to death then. (and that’s if you have a combat title that gives you a 2x bonus and have gotten to the max level to BEGIN with ) Yeah, have fun with that. It sucked and it wasn’t even WORTH it.  For bragging rights?  Meh.  Guess so.

You will never feel incredibly strong even after months and MONTHS of work.  I speak from experience:  (read: It’s been YEARS)

Welp. At least I get to walk around in a penguin costume?  :3

reviewText: I don't know what keeps bringing me back to this game. I keep quitting every couple months and just end up picking it back up. It has amazing music, and an awesome fighting system. It's great for a F2P MMO, but don't get me wrong, it has it's downsides. Mostly being that you can get filthy rich by throwing money at the game. You can get money without doing so as well, it just depends on if you want to spend money. There's plenty of quests, and a decent story to keep you busy for quite awhile. I would definitely pick this up if you need something to pass the time. Oh did I mention you can basically make your own music and other people can hear it? That right there is amazing in itself.

reviewText:
First lets start with the main bad issue: It is very laggy due to the events they keep adding, and now the server overload for adding it to steam. Also, keep in mind that this game is on a custom built engine.

Thats really the only complaints I hav.e

The good? Everything else. Variety of Skills (COUNTLESS of skills, each one can be leveled), Countless of customization options for you and your weaponry, A Big but learnable world, .. there's much more that you can do here that you wont be able to do with your typical MMO. This is NOT like other MMO's.

And last comment: THIS IS NOT PAY TO WIN. I can not STRESS that. Look at their bloody shop before you make that assumption. Heck, read their VIP service even. There's nothing about it that can boost your abilities. NOTHING. You cant buy gold. you cant buy strength. At the very worst, you can buy EXP buffs that last 10 minutes.

reviewText:
Updated as of August 22 2014
-

One of the most unique MMO rpg's out there today, this game has Transformations, Demigod, Dungeons, Field Bosses and the Fantasy Life aspect of the game.

Only downside the community is pretty bad and the game can get hyper expensive with Pets, Service, Cash shop items.


-Cons
Service costs 14$ for vip monthly it's as expensive as a pay to play game except without the exlusive content and dedicated developers..

Customer service will never get back to you.. ever.. (all Nexon games in general)
The game needs to renew dungeons to match shadow missions (experience)

Melee / Fighter is the best dps class in the game and easiest to get (1600 ap)

Game Engine is showing it's age and the open world is really instanced regions..

-Pros

Weekly Reborns (New)
Free Reborns up to level 1,000 (Only for new players)
Constaint game updates
Unique looking pets / Skills
Fast Paced Combat system
Good Story
Lots of choice for Gear

Easy to get into for newer players (it used to be much harder)

reviewText: I've been playing Mabinogi since 2009. As a veteran MMO player this game is great. It has a variety of crafting recipes and minigames that is sure to keep you entertained. The combat is fast paced and requires actual skill and knowledge of hotkeys, and is certainly a welcome change to the constant clicking of the mouse. reviewText:
Mabinogi has come along way over the years, or so I've heard... I wasn't around in the beginning, only since the 7th Anniversary or so...

Truth is this game is fun, and kinda cutesy.

Pros:

+Aging & Rebirth - Be any age from 10 - 25+
+Cute Anime - Self-explainatory
+Truly Class-less leveling system
+In-game Costumes are plentiful
+Now you get more characters (six i believe) and 2 free pets (without inventory slots, but mountable)
+Everything in the game has a cost, and most things can be bought with play-money (gold)
+Fun - atleast for those who precieve fun as doing their own thing
+Now Races other than humans can get more than 1 free character.
+Accelerated Time(Erinn Time) / Real Time(PDT) Hybird Time System.
+The Game is constantly being actively maintained and updated
+Game has something for everyone - Fashion,Dungeons,Fields,Poor Chat Moderaton xD

Cons:

-Although not pay-to-win the game is much more enjoyable if you spend money on it.
-The game can be boring and repeative, especially once you get all the skills you are looking for
-NX or Pon (aka USD) are required for quite a few appearance options.
-Objectives in game are alittle unclear at times, and sometimes you have to create your own to suffice the mean time.
-The Game's got a character creation system that screams, Don't Delete Characters" - b'cuz you have to buy "cards" which are 1-time use character slots
date:
once you use a card it's "used up" and a character takes it's place - however this is a one-way transaction as deleting the character does *not* return the card.

Misconceptions:
Mabinogi has many misconceptions surrounding itself. Yeah it's more enjoyable if you pay
recommended: no it's not pay-to-win.\nYeah the combat system has some elements that are tied into the cashshop but no they really aren't that big a deal.\nYeah everything seems out of reach
hoursPlayed: but that's part of the fun of collecting
voteText: no 2 players have the exact same set of clothes for example.\nAnother Misconception - Dyes require USD - NO! They require USD to buy the "Normal(Paletted) Dyes" (but you can also buy them from other players) but "Fixed Color/Flashy Dyes" can easily be obtained via in-game methods.\nEven More - The game's community sucks; True enough at one point
helpfulPercent: but the majority of the hell raisers are gone for good.\nAnd last but certainly not least - You can't use the same character to gain every skill - except for racials (of which there may be 6 between all 3 races) totally untrue
votesHelpful: it'll just take forever to master them all.\n\nEdit: Although I still believe it far too long for them to act
votesTotal: my faith in Nexon's Technical Support hass been restored hence the removal of the con on that effect."
votesFunny: February 9, 2015
commentsCount: true
column17: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Mabinogi one of the longer lasting MMO titles, dating even WoW by one year. Started in korea before making its way over to America. While Nexon America has made some bad marketing decisions from time to time, they're usually spot on when it comes to Mabinogi. If you're under a total of 1000 levels you're considered a beginner and despite its homely appearence the game is quite brutal. Not vindictus brutal or god of war but you feel pain after taking 60 damage. they're still using Polygons for their character models but that holds its old school charm when combined with its cell shaded graphics. The game has an easy to follow storyline and gets pretty immersive but I'm going to keep this as neutral as possible. First I'm going to look at the cons.

If you made it this far good. Here's the con list:
-Most customizations cost actual money. before you gripe I'm talking cosmetics.
-While free to play some things you have to buy if you want to look nifty. If you're cool with getting your own look through hard work then play free. I do reccomend saving up for at least one Karma koin at some point as a just in case you hit over level 1000.
-Rebirth's do cost money but for the first 1000 levels its free.
-Tough combat. This game doesn't have auto attack you have to click each time you want to hit your enemy. It follows a very rock-paper-sissors combat formula. While rewarding, mess up and you end up hurting.
- Prices. In game armor and weapons are expensive and repairs can get pricey. While the numbers may not look all that impressive they do stack up.
- Death and Ressurection. Is both a positive and negative. Its highly inconvienient to die in a dungeon but at the same time if the boss killed you its because of a reason. when you're out of nao stones is when dying is bad but normally its a drop in the pan.
- camping field penalties. Killing field enemies is rough in that stay in one area too long and you'll get penalized. Getting less and less each kill.
- Cel shaded graphics. This is for those of you who are very nitpicky. Its cel shaded so if you don't like those I put this here and in the positives.
-Hard work. If you're like me and have a blacksmith, or a similar profession in game you know that its not easy being that. You need materials which sometimes means going after dangerous enemies. It can suck but the reward is in the product. See positives.
- Solo play. This is very hard to do as there is power in numbers.
- time consuming.

Positives:
+ Use any gear. You can use any gear avaliable to you as long as its in your inventory. Want to be a ninja gunslinger? Go ahead. You just need a shuriken, dual pistols, ninja skills and gunslinger skills. Want to be an explorer? Then grab some gear and go do some dungeons for that loot.
+ Rewarding combat. When you're doing well in combat it feels very rewarding especially if it means maximising your loot by the boss of a dungeon.
+ soundtrack. Great soundtrack that is very catchy and nostalgic. After 8 years of playing this I'm still going back to this classic.
+ dungeoning with friends. While chaotic this is still very fun. At times a necessity as the later dungeons become longer and harder to complete.
+ many ways to level. whether its leveling up from gathering eggs from chicken, defeating wolves or mining ore there are plenty of ways to earn money and level up.
+ the options. As long as you know the skill you can use it. There are even some secret skills that used to be harder to learn like the Fire Arrow skill.
+ getting to higher levels of combat. This in and of itself is rewarding to see enemies that previously murdered you deal only one damage.
+ generally a very supportive community. I myself have on several occasions handed out armor and weapons I crafted by hand to people without gear. If you're not an archer and you see an archer, give them some arrows.

Neutral:
+/- Time consuming. Don't let it rule your life. Remember, its a virtual world, its not going anywhere.
+/- traveling can take time but good things happen to those who wait.
+/- rebirthing after a cetain point costs money for character cards.

ultimately I think if you like games similar to mabinogi then give it a shot. This game isn't for everyone but you'll never know until you try it. I reccomend it to those who like being creative and getting into a world. I'm someone who first went to Mabinogi as an escape and now go back to it as a fan.

reviewText:
Mabinogi is a game based off of the Celtic myths called Mabinogions. I don't know much about celtic mythology, but the game's icon is based off the celtic knot. The game is made by Koreans who are well-versed in the art of coding crack cocaine into video game form.  You look like an anime character from the PS2 era, doing mundane tasks to rank up how well you can sheer a sheep, or mix strawberry milk.

Onto the gameplay,
This game has no excuse to run at 15 fps at some places, being from the 2000s. If you can get past the horrible engine this game forces you to play on, you're in for some not very exciting gameplay. The game is based off of a rock-paper-scissor type combat (at least for the basic combat skills, this starts to matter less once you get more specialized skills) which would work well if the game didn't lag to ♥♥♥♥ing oblivion.

I forgot to mention the lag. Depending on the day you play, time of day, position of the sun and moon, and if your oven's clock is synced to your microwave's clock, the game can lag terribly to unplayable.

After 6 days (everyday if you are under a total level of 1000), you can rebirth and reset to level 1, but keep the progress you have made on any skills you were ranking up. This is a core aspect of the game. Optionally, you can use rebirth potions that you can buy with real life money (NX) to rebirth anytime. Eventually, you'll be level 80 after one day and have a whole 5 days to wait, wondering what the hell to do now. The game tries to keep you playing everyday with events, and opportunities to give you more ability points (what you use to rank up skills, these run out very fast).

The community is absolutely awful, since it mainly attracts weeaboos, middle schoolers, weeaboo middle schoolers, edgy middle schoolers, edgy high schoolers, people from Gaia online, and actual adults who spend way too much money on a Japanese anime life simulator. All of the above will try to prove how much better than you they are by using the classic my damage is higher than yours" reason. Although this doesn't really change the fact that you are both playing a Chinese timesink.

One thing I do like about this game is it's NPC art. Not the graphics themselves
date: but the little portraits that appear when you talk to NPCs. Also there's cute waifus which is VERY nice. The music is ok
recommended: some pieces are actually pretty good. But one of the things that attracted me to this game originally was the fact that there are musical instruments in the game
hoursPlayed: and you can compose songs using MML (Music Macro Language). Eventually

I guess. Play it if you have a few hundred-thousand hours to waste. It's easier with friends.

reviewText: Its worth a download for the experience, you really have to earn your keep in this game. It is a bit like Dark Souls in the sense that it is hard and a bit unforgiving, but plays like a turn-based hack and slash. Everyone can get any skill, there are no class-limited options, only race-limited options. These race-limited options also come with pros and cons, basically that Giants have the most melee damage at the cost of ranged/magic. Elves have the most magic/ranged bonuses at the cost of melee. Your in-betweener the Human, being the slowest, plenty capable of having the best of both worlds without taking penalty, but not having straight increases like the Elves or Giants may have.\nBottom-line, this is a huge world where everyone is equal and we all have to outsmart our enemy.

reviewText:
This is quite possibly my favorite MMORPG.  It's simple but addictive as hell.  I'm hoping that it will become more popular because the channels seem more barren lately.  I've been playing this game off and on since 2009 and there's about 2000 hours unaccounted for by Steam.  I've spent plenty on this game, probably far more than I should have, but it is just too much fun.  Getting with the right group can make or break the experience for you.

The game has been streamlined and cuts out a lot of what was there in terms of quest based padding to get some of the earlier quest lines out of the way. I was able to get through the first story (G1) in about a day and G2 is shaping up the same way with G3 not far behind.  I'm hoping that with redoing G2 I'll get another crack at being a Paladin so I can make other skills easier to train.

There's always something to do.  There are no set classes so you can be whatever you want.  Any weapons, spell, combat skill, or life skill is available to you with only a handful of abilities segregated for race.  They've made it so that you can spam to Lv1000 and catch up quick and still be a beginnger so that you're not lagging behind the veteran players so far. Earning levels is also much easier for everyone.  Once you hit the Lv1000 and Lv2000 milestones, you can start new characters at those levels and not have to completely start over on another character.  This is a HUGE boon considering that it wasn't like this from the beginning.  There are many more free options to play so you don't even have to pay to get access to most of the options in the game unless it's something extra that you're really looking to get.  Even so, there's generally plenty of spill over from the paying players that the pay items are readily available to free players for in-game gold.

The battle system can leave a little to be desired if you're getting slammed by four or five enemies at once, but if you're in a party it evens out.  I personally really enjoy the life skills because it leads to more business options.  There's a lot of support now that wasn't there before for those who really want to focus on building life skills.  No more are we forced into battle to gain AP in order to build our life skills.  It's wonderful.  It's not for everyone, but it's a second home for me and I love it.  If you're ever on Tarlach server, look me up!

reviewText: Very good MMO, I give it a 9/10, the only problem is probably a slow start in the game. Combat and movement is very easy to learn and master. It's not a pay to win game, but it is hard to get large amounts of gold (which is good since then not everyone is super rich and has the best equipment in the game). Most of the really good equipment is usually gotten through boss fights, dungeons, and shadow missions: people have incentive in going into them. Guilds are awesome, being able to join a guild and always having other people to do these boss fights, dungeons, and shadow missions with. One suggestion is to make the less flashy classes like warrior to become more flashy, since they do not have any special or cool skills like fighter or mage. I would also like for the dungeons to have better drops or become harder since the really high leveled people in the game can solo it easily. Other then that this game is super fun and cool, the best MMO I've ever played, the graphics are awesome too which is a plus of course!

reviewText: I'm going to boil this down into one phrase: Anime Celtic Mythology. If you think that's an awful idea, then the rest of this review will be meaningless, since that's the main draw of the game.\nTo start with, it's your basic Korean MMO, where you can grind forever and make marginal progress if you so desire. Can be fun, can be quite dull. But if we go back to that phrase I began with, there is a reason I absolutely love the game. A storyline's included, intertwining Brionac, Lugh, Morrighan, the Tuatha De Dannan, Tir Na Nog, the Fomori, Druids, it goes on. Known as Generation" quests
date: it places the player front and center in this story
recommended: and carries it well with the art style. There's some later Generation quests that I'm still scratching my head about
hoursPlayed: but following the storyline will get you a good deal of enjoyment out of the game.\nGameplay's not similar to any other MMO I've played. It's a mix of real-time and turn-based combat
voteText: to the best of my descriptive ability. When a player or enemy lands an attack
helpfulPercent: normally they can follow up with some sort of combo. Once the combo ends
votesHelpful: the recipient is knocked back a short distance. If both simply run at each other attempting to attack again
votesTotal: mor often than not the tables will quickly turn. The key is to anticipate what kind of attack the opponent's going to try
votesFunny: and react accordingly to open up another combo of your own.\nThe graphics at full settings may not be the best

column16: the game runs itself perfectly fine in the background and ceases taxing your processor if you intend on doing so.\nAnime Celtic Mythology. I'm dead serious

reviewText:
For what you can do within this game is great, even for how old it may be. Not only that, but they keep coming up with updates with newer features every so often, and it is a fantasy mmorpg for sure.

However, it is probably more worthwhile to play spending quite a few dollars in it, for example: Pets. Pets can not only be a good extention to inventory space, but help in combat. Downside to them, is their spawn time, where its like even older mmo rpg games ive played like Dungeon Siege, where summons have time limits, but Mabinogi's pet time is considerably worse, seeing as how they only have a set time for a full 24 hours and cant be taken out until the next 24 hours.

I've spent quite alot of time playing this game, since generation 1 i believe, and have had my ups and downs, but i've definitely enjoyed my time playing mostly, and thats just when I find suitable dungeons for my level and want nice clothing or better gear.

I feel this game is a hardcore kind of game, seeing as how it has alot of realistic aspects to it, where if armor being repaired can actually break, and lose durability, which then can also eventually make it un-wearable... but because of that, makes it a challenge, and something to look forward when you get more gold from those few dungeons you ran for hours earlier that day.

But if theres anything that really brings down the game, it would probably have to be Nexon. Nexon's support for I think any game, really, ends up being the worst I have probably ever been victim and witness to, seeing as how a ticket for support can be put up for 4 whole years and not once be looked at, while my account being hacked atleast a maximum of 8 times wont even be a care for Nexon it seems, sadly enough, but it could just be me and my friends that have had support issues.

Other than that above paragraph, ive had quite a blast meeting people who really gave me the feels, good friends came from this game alone, and I have yet to quit playing it for good.

reviewText: Mabinogi is great if you like grindy skill games. Theres a lot of skill types including the typical mage, warrior and archer sets but with the addition of life skills, fighter, dual gun, alchemy, ninja,  puppetry, music, etc. Overwhelming enough? Each of those skill sets has roughly 10-25 skills in its category that you need to rank up from rank F through rank A and then from rank A through rank 1. You rank these skills with AP that you get from leveling up. And that's where the concept of 'rebirthing' comes into play. Every two weeks you can rebirth your character back to level one. You are probably thinking whats the point then if all of my leveling is gone to waste?" Well
recommended: you keep all of your stats and ranks. Only your base level changes. And current level doesn't matter as much as total level anyways. Your total level is just all of your rebirthed levels added together. (Situational reference to enhance understanding) Think of it as collecting cherries. You grab a handful of 20 cherries. But then you put them in your cherry picking basket. That doesn't mean they're gone
hoursPlayed: they're just in the basket and youre hands are now free to collect more cherries. (End sidenote) When I first started playing 3 years ago I wish someone would have told me what I'm saying now because the concept of rebirthing seemed idiotic and counter productive to me at first. Its really just a way to allow you to collect AP easier since unleveled characters are simple to level up.\n\nAnd theres tons of other things to do in mabi. The community is great
voteText: everyone I've met has been nice. You can grind dungeons
helpfulPercent: explore the reaches of Iria
votesHelpful: go on hundreds of side quests or finish the main quests and get your trans. You can collect trans medals and transform into animals or other npcs or collect titles for buffs or craft weapons. Theres tons of weapons that can be upgraded and enchanted and reforged to be even stronger. There's even a huge fashion side to mabinogi if your someone who just likes to dress up your character in expensive clothing and stand around. Theres tons of pets too that give buffs and even fly. Mabinogi has something for everyone. Personally
votesTotal: I enjoy the market the most with the idea of personal shops and the housing board where you can set your own prices on your items to sell. And a lot of it is based on supply and demand which is fun to watch prices fluxuate and trying to sell your items when the sale price is at its highest. Nexon is constantly having events and gachas that keep the game interesting and fun. When you first start everything can be super overwhelming but don't be afraid to ask someone for help. Everyone who plays remembers how confusing it could be when they first started out and they will make an effort to help you.\n\nGreat game."

reviewText:
Battle System( Yes! ): I love this Click-to-hit battle system and have yet to find another MMO that *HAS* this kind of combat system, let alone *lets you play dressup with clothing and face options* IN THE SAME GAME

Art Style( Yes! ): The game is 3D yes, but the assets are a comic-artist's dream, everything looks to be hand drawn, so your avatar ends up looking like an anime character no matter what appearance options you choose. The dressing room supplies you with a catalogue of haristyles, mouths, eyes, and skintones that apper to be straight out of a How to draw manga characters" manual :)

Replayability( Meh... ): There are no randomly generated field quests
date: so there's nothing to sit around and wait for. So the only way to avoid sitting around is to actually get up and run a dungeon or read a Job Board. You will not find quest NPCs out in the middle of nowhere.\n\nPromotes group tactics?( NO . ): Almost every quest
recommended: and mission in this game is soloable and people would rather run them alone. This game hasn't been an MMO in terms of group-quests in years and does not promote the use of party groups whatsoever in any of its new questlines. There are no group quests outside of events and Campaigns(within reason
hoursPlayed: hence lacking just enough for me to claim this statement). Quest and Mission rewards do NOT scale based on participation
voteText: so having a partner with you has no boost in rewards gained. Because of this
helpfulPercent: people choose to run everything alone to avoid greifing.\n\nRaids?( Meh.. ): There are only 3 raids in this game: Black Dragon
votesHelpful: White Dragon
votesTotal: and Girgash. Since Nexon is dumb(to say the least)
votesFunny: they release a new Gachapon(web shop item) almost every month containing random rewards that far outclass anything you could craft yourself in-game. This renders the need to participate in Dragon Raids pointless and you will be hard-pressed to find anyone willing to Raid more than once a week(at the time of this review).\n\nCrafting?( Meh.. ): Yes there is crafting in this game. The wiki contains a catalogue of every creature in the game that you can possibly fight and they each tend to drop their own exclusive items. This makes crafting quite an adventure on its own
commentsCount: but sadly: The crafting manuals are never updated and almost ALL of the new/event outfits and weaponry aren't craftable. Period. reviewText: Mabinogi is a game deep to me on so many levels, having played it off and on for roughly 6 years. To this day, it provides an experience no other game can quite capture, though saying that also gives me personal grief. The updates the game has seen in the last few years have not played well to the game's strengths, and have soiled what I once considered a historically inspired" MMO.\n\nUp through the first major expansions
date: the title held true to its Celtic and Irish mythos and assets-- which is bizzare because the art style doesn't inherently lend to that type of setting. True with any MMO
recommended: the developers sought to appeal to the playerbase en masse
hoursPlayed: and tossed aside their creative direction in favor of something more widely appealing (being anime
voteText: japanese culture

votesHelpful: just before the expansion involving Iria and additional playable races. The playerbase was not centered in any one area due to convenience

Pros

Cons

reviewText:
Mabinogi is without a doubt a diamond in the rough.

Anime inspired MMORPG's have a stigma of being boring and generic, Mabinogi offers much to break this stigma. At first glance the game looks simple enough though it's not till you've entered the world of Erinn will you truely appreciate the games mechanics. Graphically the game is not anything to marvel at, using the excuse that the game is old and dated does little to soften the blow. I remember playing this in it's early days and even then the graphics weren't up to the top tier MMO's out at the time. That being said the game's graphics are unique enough to not get completely washed away with what is offered today though it is evident that it's graphics won't be a big selling point in whether someone would play this game or not. The sound direction in the game is nice and cheery for the most part. Whilst exploring you won't find many out of place sounds but at times you won't hear anything at all, though that's not a bad thing. By not hearing anything at times you gain a sense of loneliness which inturn brings you to make choices that ultimately benefit your experience. Grouping up with others is where the game truely shines. Being an amazing fighter means little if you have nothing to fight for, Playing beautiful music means little if there is noone to listen to it and the mabinogi experience offers little if one has noone to share it with.

Mabinogi was a game I played back in it's first year of release and till this day I have tremendous respect for it. The overall game design works in perfect harmony with the games mechanics and it is evident that the design choices were made with a set goal in mind which I think they accomplished.

A small issue I have with Mabinogi isn't an issue with the game itself but with it's steam integration. Unlike some of the other nexon games currently found on the steam F2P section, Mabinogi seems to have the most troubles being integrated with steam. If you want to play the game then I would highly recommending downloading the game directly from it's website which can be found published under Nexon.

Mabinogi is one of my favorite MMORPG's of all time, it's unique and very memorable. Anyone who has never played it but has some kind of interest in it should definitely try it out as this game is really an experience to be had and a marvel of excellent game design.

reviewText:
Let's give this another shot without the pointless tangent:

This is a Korean MMORPG and everything that might lead you to suspect, by which I mainly mean that sometimes the whole code feels like a house of cards ready to blow up in a storm of bugs and embarassment at seemingly any or no provocation. This is compounded by a proneness to serious lag, which loves to pop up in the middle of combat just to murder your face for trying. Many-to-most features of the game are quite opaque and tricky to understand, and there's a lot of grindy crap.

But, uh... Well, I enjoy it. It gets easier to enjoy as you get used to its flaws, I think.

The combat would actually be quite fun if only it were less laggy and buggy, as it does at least have a nice weight to it. And then, if you'd rather not fight so much, well, there's just so much to friggin' do in this game. Go into one of many schools of combat if you want, or choose a more peaceful lifestyle of commerce or production, bearing in mind that you'll almost certainly want to be able to hold up in a fight whatever you do. It's a big and engaging world that's fun to just hang around in. The playerbase is... hmm. Well, it's... you can find some good folks, but I'm just glad it's easy to blacklist people.

If you end up paying for anything, it will probably be pets, which can serve all kinds of useful functions to include simple combat backup and extra inventory space. You'll want inventory space.

Anyway the point is, this is the sort of game where you can lose yourself for a long time if you're not careful. I seem to get a little more lost every time I come back to it. Honestly I'm okay with it. It's impressively far from perfect, but ultimately a good time.

They could work on the customization skills so that way its more free rather than having to have some sort of pon accumulations that you, I believe, can only get use real life money- BUT ITS GREAT. This is definately for everyone who enjoys anime or maybe even not, to try out. There are wasd controls, which though Ive never seen them before, so its new to me, which add lots of freedom for playing the game rather than dull point and click (though that is included in case you're more comfortable with that rather than wasd). I hope this review was of help to you :D

reviewText:
UPDATE: They have shortened the story and main questline pretty drastically.
The game has lost a lot of the original charm and is now almost completely pay to win.
Many of the servers can be considered near dead and the game is even more poorly maintained than when I had played a lot in beta to G6.

If you do end up trying Mabinogi I would suggest avoiding a lot of the community as they are pretty toxic/dangerous people nowadays.

I don't think I would recommend the game unless you're interested in the crafting and social aspect as there are many MMOs that will fufill your needs for anything else a lot better. I recommend FFXIV if you're looking for an anime-esque MMO with good customization and solid combat.


~~~~
Old Review:

I joined the game originally as a closed beta tester, there was almost nothing to do, but the interesting combat/skill system caught my attention and I continued to play the game. Since then they've added a ton of free content- such as singing, piano playing, dual gunning, farming, commerce, shadow-missions, etc.

There's weeks worth, if not more, of storyline content to play and they're still adding more. The leveling system makes it so you can always play any 'class' you want and have any and all skills or equipment you desire. You do have to rebirth once in a while to reset your level and get the ability points required to level skills efficiently, but fortunately it was made far easier when they somewhat recently added a conveniently free rebirth every time you hit age 21 in-game, which takes 3 real-life weeks after a rebirth to the maximum age.

There is also quite a bit to choose from in ways of character customization, and if you don't fancy the anime style there are a few more neutral choices, as well as different races to choose from. You can also edit your characters height, and gain or lose weight and muscles depending on what you eat. There are also tons of clothing and armors to choose from, as well as dyes- although some colors are somewhat difficult to achieve, but there are always fixed-color dyes available from rebirth, gachapons, and other players.

They're currently giving out a free Holiday pet, along with the two free mounts you get for joining the game. Unfortunately a lot of the older pets have been retired and may or may not be re-released, but there are still a decent amount currently available. There's still a lot more to experience in the game, but you should try out the rest for yourself. If you ever need more information about the game you can always go to the mabinogiworld wiki, which although fan-made is pretty in-depth, active, and well-written. All things considered, I do recommend the game despite it's flaws and old age. It's definitely a unique experience and still pretty fun if you can get into it.

reviewText:
Unlike most mmos where the combat is automatic and everybody is wearing the same gear this game allows you to create your own identity of sorts. Not only can you just pick and choose what skills you would like along your journey but you can pick out your own outfit from a large selection of clothes. In this game the battle system is real time and you can be knocked back or even knocked DOWN, same goes for the monsters you fight. You have to be constantly on your toes making combos, it's not that forgiving.

We have a large selection of classes that you don't even have to dedicate yourself to as you have the freedom to just expand to any and all at any given time. It's as easy as switching out your weapons from swords to wands. You can dual wield swords with humans or maces with giants. Giants can use 1 hand to wield 2 handed swords normally meant for humans and can also equip a shield with it. Giants can't dual wield 2 handed swords tho.

Going back to clothes, you can color your outfits to your liking and you very rarely find people wearing the same stuff as you. When you put on an outfit you're making a statement about yourself and creating your own identity and that is the fun part about clothes.

reviewText:
YES! This game has been running for a solid 8 years and still going strong. The story is immersive and well done. The art style is old but very effectife for the anime type. Combat is by far the BEST combat system I have seen in ANY mmo. It requires skill and timing as well as knowledge of how to counter situations. To learn skills you must use them and meet certain requirements to upgrade them.

The game has slightly shifted to a pay 2 win style with reforges in the cash shop, but it's not enough to really effect you if you simply don't buy them.

I highly recommend this game to anyone seeking a good MMO. Give it a chance and I also highly recommend you select a busy server such as Mari (forgot the other one). It's important to have many people available as some content can be challenging without a group.

reviewText:
The first time heard about Mabinogi was in 2009, way back before it was a standalone launcher and not on Steam. I heard it bing a fantasy life game where you could virtually be anything you want, as long as it was reasonable. I thought this game was a big lie, until I tried it.  It was as amazing as they promised it would be, letting you become a musician with a huge amount of string and wind instruments and the ability to write any song!  You could become a chef creating dishes that tasted good with a few tools to help you that kept it easy to do and not so complicated. You could become a warrior, knight, bowman, mage, and fighter, each with its own verstile equipment and skills! The thing that made Mabinogi truly great was the fact that they let you do all this- at the same time. You could eaisly switch off from being a warrior to chef if you had enough AP (ability points). Also the fact that every time your character hit age 20 he/she could rebirth to level 1 again and age 10-17  for free! You wouldnt even lose the skills you learned before rebirth! For all of you wondering right now if this game is great, I say it's probably the best MMO you will play in a long time.


Note: This game IS NOT  PTW ( Pay to Win) though it just requires some dedication to get a vast colection of money

reviewText:
Can you tell I've wasted my life on this?  Granted a lot of that is AFK time, but it also doesn't count all the time I put in prior to it hooking into Steam.

Overview:

Graphics: B-. not great even by 2004 standards (when this was released in Korea), but stylized heavily enough that you will still enjoy them from an aesthetic standpoint.

Music: A++.  Hanstone is second only to SoundTEMP (putting Mabi second only to RO) in terms of background music.

Story: Solid A.  Well made and involved story across 15 full generations released so far over the life of the game.  Solid lore and worldbuilding come together as the plot advances, giving you tidbits of the past (loosely based on Celtic mythology).  A long series of deeply involved quests (none of the MMO standard kill tons and tons of X
recommended: farm that" junk) leading up to many epic and challenging (unless you bring some powerful friends along) battles and bosses.\n\nCombat: A+ Real action combat. Some of the best you will find in an MMORPG.  Entirely unique style (somewhat copied later by SMT: Imagine).  None of that lock and auto WoW clone nonsense.  Simple core mechanics of hitstun and knockdown give weight to everything you do
hoursPlayed: with just as much emphasis on reacting to the enemy as there is on figuring out how to combo your own skills.  With skilled play
voteText: avoiding taking damage entirely is extremely possible.  Combine that core with dozens of skills from a multitude of talents that you can mix and match at will (there are no classes/jobs
helpfulPercent: learn and train whatever you want) and you end up with limitless possibilities.  There are no forced or defined roles.  Lag CAN be an issue if you are on a bad connection
votesHelpful: but most people will be fine.\n\nF2P model: Recently upgraded to B+.  All of the core gameplay is now entirely free.  Premium service can be purchased if desired
votesTotal: but it's just some bonus convenience.  Pets can be purchased (and are permanent)
votesFunny: in addition to the ones you can earn for free (and the free pegasi for completing the Saga are better than most paid ones).  The closest thing to a pay2win left in are reforges
commentsCount:
but the game has a strong economy and those can be easily bought from other players fairly cheap (and not really necessary outside of minmaxing)



Overall it gets an A.  Great choice for how to spend your time
column16:
and you will spend a LOT of it.


Stick around if you are interested
column17: I'll go over some of the key mechanics that differ from other MMOs.\n\nStart with the skill and rebirth system.  Every time you level up (or from a few other possible methods) you earn 1 AP (ability point).  You spend these to rank up your skills.  Obviously it's easier to level up when you are a lower level
column18: so once per week you are allowed to (but not forced to) rebirth.  Rebirthing resets your level to 1
column19: and lets you pick an age from 10-17.  Age normally increases by 1 every Saturday
column20: giving you a boost to stats and some AP.  Depending on your age
column21: the stats you gain on levelup will change.  Early on this can make a big difference
column22: so consider picking an age that makes training the stats you use most for combat easier to get.  As you can guess
column23: resetting your level to 1 on rebirth does reset your stats gained from leveling.  However
column24: the main way of gaining stats is not from leveling
column25: but from ranking your skills.  Each rank of a skill comes with certain permanent stat gain that will persist through rebirth.  So
column26: while you may temporarily revert to being weaker
column27: the overall result makes you much stronger.\n\nI have mentioned that there are no classes
column28: but every time you rebirth you DO get to pick a talent.  Talents give you double training in a certain set of skills
column29: as well as a small boost to stat gain on levelup relevant to those skills.  You MAY opt to pay for one of the Ace talents
column30: which is simply a set of 3 normal talents at once
column31: along with its 3 ace skills that normally do not receive 2x training from anything.  You can still learn and train any skill in the game regardless of talent
column32: and mix and match as you see fit.\n\nIn addition to the various sets of combat and supportive skills
column33: there are life skills.  These vary slightly from other games' crafting in the way they work.  If
column35: you wanted to make a hairband from scratch
column36: you first need to use shearing to collect wool from some sheep
column37: then use weaving to spin the wool into thread
column38: and weave the thread into fabric.  Finally
column39: you can use tailoring to assemble it into the hairband.\n\nTo rank any skill up
column40: you first need to train it.  The skill will give you a set of conditions to fill that each earn an amount of skill exp.  When you reach 100 or higher
column41: you are then allowed to spend AP to rank the skill up.  This can be a grind
column42: so be prepared for that.  Some skills require you to interact with enemies at a certain combat level.  This is measured by the difference in combat power
column43: a value based on your stats and strongest skills that determines how strong you are and what the relative difficulty of an enemy is.  Train these early.  Later on you can get enchanted gear to reduce your combat power
column44:
but it is best to simply train early while there are plenty of easy to defeat monsters available still rated as much stronger than you.



That's the basics for why Mabinogi is a very *different* MMORPG experience than you are probably used to.  Give it a shot."

reviewText: This is a one of a kind game that everyone should give a chance. Mabinogi is a fantasy anime MMORPG with a rich character development system, unique combat system, and a rich story that separates it from other generic MMORPGs. As you dive into the world of Erinn, you can do a variety of things. From fighting monsters, performing quests, and leveling up to fishing, jousting, dressing up, and even playing and composing music. Each time a player gains enough experience from doing these kinds of activities, they will receive an AP (attribute point) that lets them distribute it to any skill and rank it to make them stronger or more efficient. There is a rebirth system where a player can reset their character's level in order to easily acquire more AP. This means that there is an infinite amount of levels so you can create a character that will suit your own play-style. Since the amount of content Mabinogi has to offer, the possibilities are endless. This is a game I can see myself playing for many years.

reviewText: The easiest way to describe this game would be 2007 runescape, except with an actual (REALLY REALLY FUN) combat system.\n\nMabinogi doesn't suffer from pay2win as much as most MMOs do. There is a reforge" system
date: which is the same as maplestory's cube system (use this cash shop only item to give your item random bonuses). But the tools needed for this are tradable
recommended: and somewhat cheap in the player market (plus the bonuses are rather low). There's several way to get mounts and AoE stun pets without paying a dime. The only clear cut advantage you can get with real money is rebirthing every week for $10 a week
hoursPlayed: rather than every 3 (which is probably going to change soon anyway
voteText:
juding by the updates that the other versions have received).

This game's rebirth system means you can play it casually and not fall too far behind those who play it religiously. Someone who plays about 4 hours every 3 weeks will still progress about 25% as fast as the person who grinds to level 200 combat + 30 exploration every rebirth.

My one warning to anyone who's trying this game for the first time

reviewText:
Can you tell I've wasted my life on this?  Granted a lot of that is AFK time, but it also doesn't count all the time I put in prior to it hooking into Steam.

Overview:

Graphics: B-. not great even by 2004 standards (when this was released in Korea), but stylized heavily enough that you will still enjoy them from an aesthetic standpoint.

Music: A++.  Hanstone is second only to SoundTEMP (putting Mabi second only to RO) in terms of background music.

Story: Solid A.  Well made and involved story across 15 full generations released so far over the life of the game.  Solid lore and worldbuilding come together as the plot advances, giving you tidbits of the past (loosely based on Celtic mythology).  A long series of deeply involved quests (none of the MMO standard kill tons and tons of X
recommended: farm that" junk) leading up to many epic and challenging (unless you bring some powerful friends along) battles and bosses.\n\nCombat: A+ Real action combat. Some of the best you will find in an MMORPG.  Entirely unique style (somewhat copied later by SMT: Imagine).  None of that lock and auto WoW clone nonsense.  Simple core mechanics of hitstun and knockdown give weight to everything you do
hoursPlayed: with just as much emphasis on reacting to the enemy as there is on figuring out how to combo your own skills.  With skilled play
voteText: avoiding taking damage entirely is extremely possible.  Combine that core with dozens of skills from a multitude of talents that you can mix and match at will (there are no classes/jobs
helpfulPercent: learn and train whatever you want) and you end up with limitless possibilities.  There are no forced or defined roles.  Lag CAN be an issue if you are on a bad connection
votesHelpful: but most people will be fine.\n\nF2P model: Recently upgraded to B+.  All of the core gameplay is now entirely free.  Premium service can be purchased if desired
votesTotal: but it's just some bonus convenience.  Pets can be purchased (and are permanent)
votesFunny: in addition to the ones you can earn for free (and the free pegasi for completing the Saga are better than most paid ones).  The closest thing to a pay2win left in are reforges
commentsCount:
but the game has a strong economy and those can be easily bought from other players fairly cheap (and not really necessary outside of minmaxing)



Overall it gets an A.  Great choice for how to spend your time
column16:
and you will spend a LOT of it.


Stick around if you are interested
column17: I'll go over some of the key mechanics that differ from other MMOs.\n\nStart with the skill and rebirth system.  Every time you level up (or from a few other possible methods) you earn 1 AP (ability point).  You spend these to rank up your skills.  Obviously it's easier to level up when you are a lower level
column18: so once per week you are allowed to (but not forced to) rebirth.  Rebirthing resets your level to 1
column19: and lets you pick an age from 10-17.  Age normally increases by 1 every Saturday
column20: giving you a boost to stats and some AP.  Depending on your age
column21: the stats you gain on levelup will change.  Early on this can make a big difference
column22: so consider picking an age that makes training the stats you use most for combat easier to get.  As you can guess
column23: resetting your level to 1 on rebirth does reset your stats gained from leveling.  However
column24: the main way of gaining stats is not from leveling
column25: but from ranking your skills.  Each rank of a skill comes with certain permanent stat gain that will persist through rebirth.  So
column26: while you may temporarily revert to being weaker
column27: the overall result makes you much stronger.\n\nI have mentioned that there are no classes
column28: but every time you rebirth you DO get to pick a talent.  Talents give you double training in a certain set of skills
column29: as well as a small boost to stat gain on levelup relevant to those skills.  You MAY opt to pay for one of the Ace talents
column30: which is simply a set of 3 normal talents at once
column31: along with its 3 ace skills that normally do not receive 2x training from anything.  You can still learn and train any skill in the game regardless of talent
column32: and mix and match as you see fit.\n\nIn addition to the various sets of combat and supportive skills
column33: there are life skills.  These vary slightly from other games' crafting in the way they work.  If
column35: you wanted to make a hairband from scratch
column36: you first need to use shearing to collect wool from some sheep
column37: then use weaving to spin the wool into thread
column38: and weave the thread into fabric.  Finally
column39: you can use tailoring to assemble it into the hairband.\n\nTo rank any skill up
column40: you first need to train it.  The skill will give you a set of conditions to fill that each earn an amount of skill exp.  When you reach 100 or higher
column41: you are then allowed to spend AP to rank the skill up.  This can be a grind
column42: so be prepared for that.  Some skills require you to interact with enemies at a certain combat level.  This is measured by the difference in combat power
column43: a value based on your stats and strongest skills that determines how strong you are and what the relative difficulty of an enemy is.  Train these early.  Later on you can get enchanted gear to reduce your combat power
column44:
but it is best to simply train early while there are plenty of easy to defeat monsters available still rated as much stronger than you.



That's the basics for why Mabinogi is a very *different* MMORPG experience than you are probably used to.  Give it a shot."

reviewText: Let's make this review short and sweet. Amazing game with an engaging story (until after generation 12) and fun PVE. PVP is just as fun. The amount of weapons and skills to vary from and quests to do, give a player TONS to do, next to the MASSIVE world made (which no one travels). Cons? The economy as a whole. Almost no one is friendly, or truly at least and the game is completely built around needing gold to people. Yes you need good gear, but crafting is available. Items that're COSMETIC, cost MORE than items that actually are used for combat, so when you try to sell over powered combat items, you won't truly get your monies worth. If you want to play this game, either have a group of friends that already play it a fair amount, or play with friends whom haven't played. Either way, this game isn't all that bad, but should be avoided if you aren't enticed my a rather one sided economy.

reviewText:
Such an amazing, yet often overlooked game by Nexon & DevCat.
There's SO MUCH to do, so many skills, ways to do combat, character customization. It's ridiculous this game isn't more popular. The social aspect of the game is great too! I've made many great friends who I still keep in touch with outside the game. The great part of this game is, you can do EVERYTHING on ONE character! No more multiple characters to play all classes or something like that.
While the game is a little dated, expect it to run fine on older & newer computers with no problem. I wish one day there will be a major graphics overhaul and engine updates to make the game better though.

Some cons to be wary of
If you don't find friends to play with, you'll find yourself severely bored and hampered at some parts of the story.
Some skills are monsters to rank up.
And other things you'd expect of an MMO.

reviewText: I joined Mabinogi back in 2009 and have loved it ever since. The difference with Mabinogi compared to most MMORPGS is that your character is you life. You dont have to follow the questline instead of fighting, why not cook or commerce? You want to fight using a sword while having a flamethrower strapped to your wrist? Go ahead. Mabinogi is a game where YOU'RE in control. Theres no level cap so you can keep playing and getting stronger and stronger. You even get benifits once your character reaches a cetain level. The story line is catching [Although text heavy] will leave you wanting more and more. The community is one of the best you'll ever meet, don't know what to do or where to go? Simply ask anyone and they'll help. Just play this game its hard to get into but once you understand it you'll have tons of fun with friends.

reviewText:
This is a game where you feel immersed in its world. I have played countless of hours in the amazingly detailed world of Mabinogi. I have 300+ hours on Steam from when I wrote this review but I've played this game before it was even on steam, back in 2009. The world is vast and beautifully made. I have still not visited every destination and I have plans to in the future to do so. The community in this game is outstanding. Never played with such an amazing community. There are many items that you can purchase from other players with an in game economy. Or you can buy some with real money using a gachapon system (Kind of like the Team Fortress 2 crates without the keys). But you honestly don't have to buy any of those cosmetic items to enjoy the game. There are hardly any level up restrictions with no level cap. But levels don't really matter. Its all about the skills. Every time you level you gain a skill point that you can put into the many skills you will get to improve them. Rebirthing to make your level back at 1 is possible every 3 weeks if your character's age is 17. Thats my only problem. That it takes 3 weeks for you to rebirth unless you pay for a weekly rebirth. It is not needed because you will be spending those 3 weeks leveling you character like crazy if you're a beginner. Playing music with in-game instruments is an option using a music language known as MML (Music Macro Language). I would sometimes walk by an amazing composer with an amazing song or even bands that just play music for people's enjoyment. Mabinogi has a very strategic combat system with many different classes to play as. Nexon is constantly updating the game with in game events and even different storylines and generations(quest lines). You will not beat this game in a matter of weeks or maybe even months. I still haven't because of the quantity and quality of this product.

If you enjoy role playing games and MMO's you will enjoy this game. The community in this game is amazing and will make you keep coming back. This is a different kind of MMO. Its unique in its own way.
Server: Alexina
In Game Name: Cloudstride

reviewText:
I know it says that I've only played 2.5 hours in the past week, but that's because I only recently redownloaded it with Steam. I'll make a list of pros / cons towards the end of just me rambling aimlessly about it.

I started this game whenever I was in fifth grade--back then, my eyes filled with delight and curiosity whenever anything happened in this game. I was excited, I bought so many pets, and I loved it.

It's been so long, and whenever my online college classes picked up, I wanted an MMO that I could play with others. I redownloaded it during August, started playing again. Made a new character. I haven't had as much time recently to play it, but I do still enjoy it, so I decided to download it to Steam and link up my account.

Honestly? The development of Mabinogi surprised me. I never expected to see guns or anything else that's there. I never expected to see things like Ninja" or "Merlin". Though
